page.title: 16FARWELL HOUSE, STOKE FLEMING
page.content: { Farwell House}was built about{400 {years}ago.In{Victorian}times it was rebuilt as the{Rectory.}It was very large. Thirty years ago it was split into two because people do not have such big families or any servants. The land was split up too.The{Coach {House}at the back is no longer part of Farwell but a separate house. At the back the barns and stables have been converted into a house called{East {Farwell.}There is a separate entrance for them onto a different road. In the gardens at the front a new {Rectory}was built. There are still large gardens with beautiful rhododen- drons and a large pond. Where there was once one house there are now several.
